result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court.  Attorney Jason Findling in court on behalf of William Hotchkiss for Cornelius Montel Kidd.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is on a leave of absence and requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-12-2022

Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Cornelius Montel Kidd.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter set for Scheduling Conference. Defense receives discovery and offer and requests plea/sentencing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

A review of the CCAP court record indicates this case should be assigned to Hon. D. Swanson, Branch 11.
It was incorrectly reassigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Case is rescheduled to Branch 11 calendar on September 14, 2022.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court with attorney William Hotchkiss. Eric Bashirian on behalf of  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Case was incorrectly assigned to Judge Feiss. Based on the Intake Schedule, parties confirmed that case should be assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Defense counsel received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time to review offer with Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Scheduling Conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am. 

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 26, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court by video with Attorney William Hotchkiss who appears in person.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer H. Young.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated June 28, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court, appear by video with attorney William Hotchkiss, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status for status of counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated June 6, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Hotchkiss needs time to meet with the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04-28-2022

22RM021055  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/20/22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Cornelius Montel Kidd in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cornelius Montel Kidd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
